title: Finding Maximum/Minimum Values from Standard Form

content.problem: Find the maximum or minimum value of the quadratic function f(x) = -2x² + 12x - 10.
steps:
Step 1: Identify whether the function has a maximum or minimum value
Since a = -2 < 0, the parabola opens downward and has a maximum value

Step 2: Find the x-coordinate of the vertex using x = -b/(2a)
x = -(12)/(2(-2)) = -12/(-4) = 3

Step 3: Calculate the maximum value by evaluating f(3)
f(3) = -2(3)² + 12(3) - 10
f(3) = -2(9) + 36 - 10
f(3) = -18 + 36 - 10
f(3) = 8

Step 4: State the answer
The maximum value of the function is 8, which occurs at x = 3
content.explanation: For any quadratic function in standard form, we can find its maximum or minimum value by first finding the x-coordinate of the vertex using the formula x = -b/(2a), and then evaluating the function at that point.
